section.title: Assignment
section.para:
Browse your colleague's repositories on github, find one you like (it could be a homework assignment, the beginnings of a final project, or something else entirely) and
Fork the repository, this will create a copy of it on your own github account. Don't worry if you already have one by the same name, github will append a number to the end of the name to differentiate it from your own
Clone the forked repo from your own github account to your local machine.
Create a file named COMMENTS in the base directory of the repository. Review the source code in the forked repo. Think about it in terms of Unix Philosophy as defined by Raymond. If you see areas for improvement, make a note of them in COMMENTS. If you can see a way to improve the code yourself, by making it more modular, or more general, make the appropriate changes, commit them to your local repository, push back to your github account and then initiate a "Pull Request" by clicking the appropriate button on the github page for the forked repository.
When you receive a pull request from a colleague, review the changes and the comments. If you feel the contribution improves your project then go ahead and merge in the changes.
